pageTitle: Itinerary for Wednesday, March 16, 2016 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Itinerary for the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, for Wednesday, March 16, 2016:

New York, New York, United States of America

10:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will make an announcement at the United Nations and will hold a media availability.

UN Secretariat Lobby, Ground Floor
United Nations Headquarters
New York City, New York

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage by accredited media


11:45 a.m. The Prime Minister will take part in an Armchair Discussion with the Executive Director of UN Women.

Economic and Social Council Chamber, 2nd floor
United Nations Headquarters
New York City, New York

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage by accredited media


1:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Secretary General of the United Nations.

UN Secretary Generalâ€™s Office, 38th floor
Secretariat Building
United Nations Headquarters
New York City, New York

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity (cameras and photographers only)
  • Accredited media only


2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a Roundtable Discussion on Girls Advocacy.

Glyn Berry Room, 14th Floor
Permanent Mission of Canada to the United Nations
New York City, New York

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity (cameras and photographers only)
  • Accredited media only


3:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Chairman and CEO of BlackRock.

Embassy Room, 3rd floor
Westin New York Grand Central
New York City, New York

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity (cameras and photographers only)
  • Accredited media only


4:10 p.m. The Prime Minister will meet with the Chairman and CEO of Xerox.

Embassy Room, 3rd floor
Westin New York Grand Central
New York City, New York

Notes for media:

  • Photo opportunity (cameras and photographers only)
  • Accredited media only


7:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will attend the 2016 Catalyst Awards Dinner and will deliver remarks.

Grand Ballroom, 3rd floor
Waldorf Astoria Hotel
New York City, New York

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage for remarks only

Accredited media only


Please note: all times are local.

PMO Media Relations: 613-957-5555
